metadata.title: CVE-2020-2732 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was discovered in the way that the KVM hypervisor handledinstruction emulation for an L2 guest when nested virtualisation isenabled. Under some circumstances, an L2 guest may trick the L0 guest intoaccessing sensitive L1 resources that should be inaccessible to the L2guest.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-2732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-42-generic - 5.3.0-42.34~18.04.1
linux-image-5.3.0-42-generic-lpae - 5.3.0-42.34~18.04.1
linux-image-5.3.0-42-lowlatency - 5.3.0-42.34~18.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-42-lowlatency - 5.3.0-42.34~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-91.92').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-42.34~18.04.1').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1076.86').
linux-oem-osp1 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1043.48').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.57').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.67').
linux-aws-5.0 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1027.30').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1035.37').
linux-azure-5.3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1016.17~18.04.1').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1033.34').
linux-gcp-5.3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1014.15~18.04.1').
linux-gke-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.58').
linux-gke-5.0 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1032.33').
linux-oracle package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.39').
linux-oracle-5.0 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.0.0-1013.18').
linux-gke-5.3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1014.15~18.04.1').
linux-oracle-5.3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1011.12~18.04.1').
